tit.e: Kunimichi KITAGAKI
Kunimichi KITAGAKI
Kunimichi KITAGAKI

sen.j: 北垣 国道（きたがき くにみち、天保7年8月7日 (旧暦)（1836年9月17日） - 大正5年（1916年）1月16日）は、明治時代の政治家、男爵。
sen.e: Kunimichi KITAGAKI (September 17, 1836 - January 16, 1916) was a statesman and baron of the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 原文には (旧暦) とありますが、リンク先の単語が抽出されるバグのようですので、訳出しておりません。
sen.e: Kunimichi KITAGAKI (September 17, 1836 - January 16, 1916) was a statesman and baron of the Meiji period.
Kunimichi KITAGAKI (September 17, 1836 - January 16, 1916) was a statesman and baron of the Meiji period.

sen.j: 幼名は捨蔵。
sen.e: His childhood name was Sutezo.
His childhood name was Sutezo.
His childhood name was Sutezo.

sen.j: 成人後、晋太郎。
sen.e: His changed his name to Shintaro after he came of age.
His changed his name to Shintaro after he came of age.
His changed his name to Shintaro after he came of age.

sen.j: 晩年は「静屋」と号する。
sen.e: He called himself 'Seioku' in his later years.
He called himself 'Seioku' in his later years.
He called himself 'Seioku' in his later years.

tit.e: Brief Personal History
Brief Personal History
Brief Personal History

tit.j: 1836年- 但馬国養父郡能座村（現・兵庫県養父市）に生まれる
tit.e: 1836: He was born in Noza Village, Yabu-gun County, Tajima Province (present-day Yabu City, Hyogo Prefecture).
1836: He was born in Noza Village, Yabu-gun County, Tajima Province (present-day Yabu City, Hyogo Prefecture).
1836: He was born in Noza Village, Yabu-gun County, Tajima Province (present-day Yabu City, Hyogo Prefecture).

tit.j: 1841年- 池田草庵の私塾「青谿書院」で学ぶ
tit.e: 1841: He studied at 'Seikei Shoin,' a private school kept by Soan IKEDA.
1841: He studied at 'Seikei Shoin,' a private school kept by Soan IKEDA.
1841: He studied at 'Seikei Shoin,' a private school kept by Soan IKEDA.

tit.j: 1863年- 生野の変に参加するも破れ、長州藩へ亡命
tit.e: 1863: He participated in Ikuno Incident, but he was defeated and sought asylum in Choshu Domain.
1863: He participated in Ikuno Incident, but he was defeated and sought asylum in Choshu Domain.
1863: He participated in Ikuno Incident, but he was defeated and sought asylum in Choshu Domain.

tit.j: 1868年1月- 山陰道鎮撫使の西園寺公望に従軍。
tit.e: January 1868: He followed the army of Kinmochi SAIONJI, the repression delegate to the Sanin region.
tit.cmt: 原文の「西園寺公望に従軍」というのは文章として少し不自然に思えます。
tit.e: January 1868: He followed the army of Kinmochi SAIONJI, the repression delegate to the Sanin region.
January 1868: He followed the army of Kinmochi SAIONJI, the repression delegate to the Sanin region.

sen.j: さらに、8月に北越戦争に従軍
sen.e: He also served in Hokuetsu War in August.
He also served in Hokuetsu War in August.
He also served in Hokuetsu War in August.

tit.e: 1879: He assumed the position of prefectural governor of Kochi Prefecture.
1879: He assumed the position of prefectural governor of Kochi Prefecture.
1879: He assumed the position of prefectural governor of Kochi Prefecture.
1880: He held another position of prefectural governor of Tokushima Prefecture.
1880: He held another position of prefectural governor of Tokushima Prefecture.
1880: He held another position of prefectural governor of Tokushima Prefecture.

tit.j: 1881年- 京都府知事に就任（- 1892年）
tit.e: 1881: He assumed the position of governor of Kyoto Prefecture (- 1892).
1881: He assumed the position of governor of Kyoto Prefecture (- 1892).
1881: He assumed the position of governor of Kyoto Prefecture (- 1892).

tit.j: 1890年- 琵琶湖疏水を完成させる
tit.e: 1890: He completed the construction of Lake Biwa Canal.
1890: He completed the construction of Lake Biwa Canal.
1890: He completed the construction of Lake Biwa Canal.
1892: He assumed the position of director (- 1896) of the Hokkaido Government Office (1886 - 1947).
1892: He assumed the position of director (- 1896) of the Hokkaido Government Office (1886 - 1947).
1892: He assumed the position of director (- 1896) of the Hokkaido Government Office (1886 - 1947).

tit.j: 1896年- 明治維新の功により男爵位を授ける
tit.e: 1896: He was baronized for his services in Meiji Restoration.
tit.cmt: 原文に「男爵位を授ける」とありますが、これだと爵位を"あげた"方になりますので、"もらった"のであれば、「賜る」「授与される」「授かる」「受ける」などの語が適当かと思われます。
tit.e: 1896: He was baronized for his services in Meiji Restoration.
1896: He was baronized for his services in Meiji Restoration.
1899: He became a member of the House of Peers (- 1912).
1899: He became a member of the House of Peers (- 1912).
1899: He became a member of the House of Peers (- 1912).
1912: He assumed the position of Privy Councilor.
1912: He assumed the position of Privy Councilor.
1912: He assumed the position of Privy Councilor.
1916: He died.
1916: He died.

sen.j: 功績と評価
sen.e: Achievements and evaluation
Achievements and evaluation

sen.j: 琵琶湖疏水
sen.e: Lake Biwa Canal
Lake Biwa Canal
Lake Biwa Canal

sen.j: 北垣が京都府知事に着任した頃の京都の街は、東京遷都などにより東京や大阪などへの人口流出、産業衰退により、都市としての活力が失われつつあった。
sen.e: When KITAGAKI assumed the position of governor of Kyoto Prefecture, the town of Kyoto was losing its liveliness as an urban community because of population drain to Tokyo, Osaka and so on, which was caused by the transfer of the capital to Tokyo, and so on; and also because of industrial recession.

When Kitagaki assumed the position of governor of Kyoto Prefecture, the town of Kyoto was losing its liveliness as an urban community because of population drain to Tokyo, Osaka and so on, which was caused by the transfer of the capital to Tokyo, and so on; and also because of industrial recession.

When Kitagaki assumed the position of governor of Kyoto Prefecture, the town of Kyoto was losing its liveliness as an urban community because of population drain to Tokyo, Osaka and so on, which was caused by the transfer of the capital to Tokyo, and so on; and also because of industrial recession.

sen.j: 北垣は、京都の勧業政策として琵琶湖から京都までの疏水建設によって、灌漑、上水道、水運、水車の動力を目的とした琵琶湖疏水を計画した。
sen.e: KITAGAKI planned, as a measure to promote industries in Kyoto, the construction of Lake Biwa Canal for irrigation, water supply, water transport and powering water wheels by building a canal between Lake Biwa and Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 用語検索で「灌漑」は "irriation" となっていますが、"irrigation" の誤りと思われます。
sen.e: Kitagaki planned, as a measure to promote industries in Kyoto, the construction of Lake Biwa Canal for irrigation, water supply, water transport and powering water wheels by building a canal between Lake Biwa and Kyoto.

Kitagaki planned, as a measure to promote industries in Kyoto, the construction of Lake Biwa Canal for irrigation, water supply, water transport and powering water wheels by building a canal between Lake Biwa and Kyoto.

sen.j: 疏水の設計は工部大学校（後の東京大学工学部）を卒業した京都府技師の田辺朔郎が進め、4年8ヶ月の大工事で完成させた。
sen.e: The design work for the canal was advanced by Sakuro TANABE, a graduate of the Imperial College of Engineering (later Faculty of Engineering, the University of Tokyo) and an engineer of Kyoto Prefecture; it was completed in four years and eight months of major construction works.

The design work for the canal was advanced by Sakuro TANABE, a graduate of the Imperial College of Engineering (later Faculty of Engineering, the University of Tokyo) and an engineer of Kyoto Prefecture; it was completed in four years and eight months of major construction works.

The design work for the canal was advanced by Sakuro TANABE, a graduate of the Imperial College of Engineering (later Faculty of Engineering, the University of Tokyo) and an engineer of Kyoto Prefecture; it was completed in four years and eight months of major construction works.

sen.j: 工期途中で視察のためアメリカ合衆国を訪れた田辺は、当初の計画になかった水力発電を取り入れ、日本初の営業用水力発電所となる蹴上発電所を建設し、1895年には京都・伏見間で日本初となる路面電車（京都電気鉄道）の営業運転が始まることとなった。
sen.e: He went on an inspection tour of the United States while the construction works were in progress, and he introduced hydroelectric system which had not been in the original plan; he built Keage Power Plant, Japan's first hydroelectric power station for business use, and in 1895, commercial operation of Japan's first streetcar (Kyoto Electric Railway) started in the section between Kyoto and Fushimi.

He went on an inspection tour of the United States while the construction works were in progress, and he introduced hydroelectric system which had not been in the original plan; he built Keage Power Plant, Japan's first hydroelectric power station for business use, and in 1895, commercial operation of Japan's first streetcar (Kyoto Electric Railway) started in the section between Kyoto and Fushimi.

He went on an inspection tour of the United States while the construction works were in progress, and he introduced hydroelectric system which had not been in the original plan; he built Keage Power Plant, Japan's first hydroelectric power station for business use, and in 1895, commercial operation of Japan's first streetcar (Kyoto Electric Railway) started in the section between Kyoto and Fushimi.

tit.e: His days as a director of the Hokkaido Government Office
His days as a director of the Hokkaido Government Office
His days as a director of the Hokkaido Government Office

sen.j: 1892年（明治25年）、もともと港湾部が浅かった上に土砂の堆積が重なって大型船の接岸が不可能になっていた函館港の改修についての要望書『函館港湾浚渫修築并ニ船渠設置意見上申書』の提出を受け、港内の浚渫や砂防堤・防波堤・灯台の設置、埋立てによる埠頭の建設などの改良工事を指示した。
sen.e: The harbor of Hakodate Port, which had been shallow since long before, had deposition of sediments so that it became impossible for large vessels to reach the shore; in 1892, in response to the submission of "Proposal for dredging and repairs of Hakodate Harbor and construction of a dock," a request for repairs of Hakodate Harbor, KITAGAKI directed dredging work of the harbor and construction of sand control dyke, breakwater and lighthouse as well as improvement works including construction of a wharf by reclaiming land from the sea.
sen.cmt: 砂防堤－定訳不明用語検索では"sand erosion control dam" となっていますが、これは砂防ダムのことだと思われます。 一応 "sand control dyke" と訳しました。
sen.e: The harbor of Hakodate Port, which had been shallow since long before, had deposition of sediments so that it became impossible for large vessels to reach the shore; in 1892, in response to the submission of "Proposal for dredging and repairs of Hakodate Harbor and construction of a dock," a request for repairs of Hakodate Harbor, Kitagaki directed dredging work of the harbor and construction of sand control dyke, breakwater and lighthouse as well as improvement works including construction of a wharf by reclaiming land from the sea.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。Kitagakiに訂正しました。
sen.e: The harbor of Hakodate Port, which had been shallow since long before, had deposition of sediments so that it became impossible for large vessels to reach the shore; in 1892, in response to the submission of "Proposal for dredging and repairs of Hakodate Harbor and construction of a dock," a request for repairs of Hakodate Harbor, Kitagaki directed dredging work of the harbor and construction of sand control dyke, breakwater and lighthouse as well as improvement works including construction of a wharf by reclaiming land from the sea.

sen.j: 1898年（明治31年）竣工。
sen.e: They were completed in 1898.
They were completed in 1898.
They were completed in 1898.

sen.j: 北海道庁長官時代の1894年（明治27年）3月、北海道の拓殖と防備を兼ねて北海道官設鉄道を計画。
sen.e: In March 1894, when he was the director of the Hokkaido Government Office, he planned to build 北海道官設鉄道 both for colonization and defense of Hokkaido.
sen.cmt: 北海道官設鉄道－定訳不明
sen.e: In March 1894, when he was the director of the Hokkaido Government Office, he planned to build Hokkaido Government Railway both for colonization and defense of Hokkaido.
sen.cmt: 北海道官設鉄道－Hokkaido Government Railway
sen.e: In March 1894, when he was the director of the Hokkaido Government Office, he planned to build Hokkaido Government Railway both for colonization and defense of Hokkaido.

sen.j: 女婿となっていた田辺を招聘し、建設のための調査を依頼した。
sen.e: He invited TANABE, who was his daughter's husband at that time, and asked him to conduct investigation for construction.
He invited Tanabe, who was his daughter's husband at that time, and asked him to conduct investigation for construction.
He invited Tanabe, who was his daughter's husband at that time, and asked him to conduct investigation for construction.

sen.j: 田辺は上川線（現函館本線の一部）の空知太（現滝川市）〜旭川市間を手始めに、のちの宗谷本線、根室本線の一部となる区間の調査と建設指揮にあたった。
sen.e: TANABE conducted the investigation and directed the construction of the section between Sorachibuto (present- day Takikawa City) and Asahikawa City in Kamikawa Line (a part of present-day Hakodate Main Line) in the beginning, and also other sections which later became parts of Soya Main Line and Nemuro Main Line.

Tanabe conducted the investigation and directed the construction of the section between Sorachibuto (present day Takikawa City) and Asahikawa City in Kamikawa Line (a part of present-day Hakodate Main Line) in the beginning, and also other sections which later became parts of Soya Main Line and Nemuro Main Line.
sen.cmt: Tanabeに訂正しました。ハイフン削除しました。
sen.e: Tanabe conducted the investigation and directed the construction of the section between Sorachibuto (present day Takikawa City) and Asahikawa City in Kamikawa Line (a part of present-day Hakodate Main Line) in the beginning, and also other sections which later became parts of Soya Main Line and Nemuro Main Line.

sen.j: 評価
sen.e: Evaluation
Evaluation
Evaluation

sen.j: 琵琶湖疏水建設は、国や京都府の財政支出のみならず、市債や寄付金などのほか、市民に対しての目的税をも財源とし、府民と一体となって取り組んだ。
sen.e: Financial resources for the construction of Lake Biwa Canal were not only the finances of the country and Kyoto Prefecture, but also municipal bonds, contributions, and special-purpose tax on citizens; he worked hard together with citizens of the prefecture.

Financial resources for the construction of Lake Biwa Canal were not only the finances of the country and Kyoto Prefecture, but also municipal bonds, contributions, and special-purpose tax on citizens; he worked hard together with citizens of the prefecture.

Financial resources for the construction of Lake Biwa Canal were not only the finances of the country and Kyoto Prefecture, but also municipal bonds, contributions, and special-purpose tax on citizens; he worked hard together with citizens of the prefecture.

sen.j: さらに、京都商工会議所などの創設などに尽力し、近代産業都市としての京都建設に大いに貢献した。
sen.e: He also devoted himself to establishment of Kyoto Chamber of Commerce and Industry and so on to contribute to the founding of the modern industrial city of Kyoto.
He also devoted himself to establishment of Kyoto Chamber of Commerce and Industry and so on to contribute to the founding of the modern industrial city of Kyoto.
He also devoted himself to establishment of Kyoto Chamber of Commerce and Industry and so on to contribute to the founding of the modern industrial city of Kyoto.

sen.j: 現在の京都の政財界において、歴代京都府知事の中で北垣を高く評価する人々が多い。
sen.e: KITAGAKI is highly regarded, among successive governors of Kyoto Prefecture, by many political or business leaders of today's Kyoto.
Kitagaki is highly regarded, among successive governors of Kyoto Prefecture, by many political or business leaders of today's Kyoto.
Kitagaki is highly regarded, among successive governors of Kyoto Prefecture, by many political or business leaders of today's Kyoto.

sen.j: 田辺と二人三脚で挑んだ琵琶湖疏水工事の物語が大阪書籍の小学校社会科教科書に掲載されていた。
sen.e: The story of the construction of Lake Biwa Canal, which KITAGAKI and TANABE had worked together hand-in-hand, was once on an elementary school textbook of social studies published by Osaka Shoseki Co., Ltd.
sen.cmt: 用語検索で「大阪書籍」は現社名の"Nihon Bunkyou Shuppan Co., Ltd."となっていますが、原文どおり旧社名で訳出しました。
sen.e: The story of the construction of Lake Biwa Canal, which Kitagaki and Tanabe had worked together hand-in-hand, was once on an elementary school textbook of social studies published by Osaka Shoseki Co., Ltd.
sen.cmt: Kitagakiに訂正しました。Tanabeに訂正しました。
sen.e: The story of the construction of Lake Biwa Canal, which Kitagaki and Tanabe had worked together hand-in-hand, was once on an elementary school textbook of social studies published by Osaka Shoseki Co., Ltd.
